name: js/classes/Interface.js
Interface
description:
Interface between the client side and the back-end.

The interface has settings and a socket enabling it 
to send and receive data from the server running the
Java MAS simulation.

name: constructor
description: Constructor setting fields and listeners.

name: socket
description: Socket to communicate with the backend.

name: settings
description: Settings of the whole environnement.

name: results
description: Results handler for calculations from the back-end.

name: simulationRunning
description: Flag signalant si une simulation est en cours ou non.

name: startSimulation
description:
Start the simulation by sending the settings to the back-end
along the message 'startSimulation'.

name: stopSimulation
description:
Stop the client-side simulation by removing the loading screen and
blocking results callback.

name: js/classes/interface/Results.js
Results
description: Deals with the results sent by the server.

name: interface
description: Interface object using this results.

name: data
description: The data computed by the server.

name: error
description: When an error is received, prints it to screen.

name: loading
description: When the server is processing, show the progress.

params.name: percent
params.description: The loading progression or false (== 0) if it just started.

name: showResults
description: When everything is okay, display paths, stats and show a simulation.

params.name: data
params.description: The results object sent by the server.

name: exportGambit
description:
Download a Gambit version of the server-computed paths.
/!\ Asynchronous as it relies on Saver::download!

name: js/classes/interface/Settings.js
Settings
description:
Settings of the simulation.

Initialize settings with default values.

name: interface
description: Interface object using this settings.

name: graph
description: The graph configuration.

name: robbers
description: The robbers configuration.

name: saver
description: A class enabling us to save the configuration (or any text file) on the client's computer.

name: loader
description: A class enabling us to load a configuration from the client's computer.

name: init
description: (Re)-Initialize every sub-settings.

name: getSettings
description:
Return settings as as JSON object.

Those settings can be sent to the backend.

name: getGeneralSettings
description:
Concatenate the general settings in one 
JSON object.

name: js/classes/interface/results/LiveSimulation.js
LiveSimulation
description:
Class enabling us to play a live simulation of the best strategy 
sent by the server.

params.name: results
params.description: Results object that instanciated this simulation.

params.name: selector
params.description: jQuery selector for where to put the simulation.

name: results
description: Results object that instanciated this simulation.

name: originalCy
description: Original cytoscape graph.

name: computedData
description: Data computed by the server.

name: bestStreategy
description: Strategy previously built.

name: selector
description: jQuery selector for where to put the simulation.

name: stylesheet
description: LiveSimulation graph stylesheet.

name: cy
description: LiveSImulation cytoscape graph.

name: base
description: Base du gardien.

name: robber
description: Node representing the robber.

name: guardian
description: Node representing the guardian.

name: newIteration
description: Launch a new iterration.

name: robberTarget
description: The robber's current target.

name: iterationStart
description: Startup tmestamp (for the robber movement).

name: countdown
description: How many ms before the robber hit the target?

name: guardianPath
description: The path the guardian will follow.

name: guardianLastVisit
description: The last node the guardian visited.

name: guardianTarget
description: The node the guardian is going to.

name: nextStep
description: Render the next step.

name: robberHitTarget
description:
Handle what happen when the robber hit his targer.
/!\ Is asynchronous because of LiveSimulation::iterationEnd use.

name: iterationEnd
description: Call for another iteration when the running one finishes.

name: nextGuardianTarget
description: Give the next target the Guardian should go for.

name: randomTarget
description: Get a random target according to the distribution (see RobbersInterest).

name: run
description: Start the simulation.

name: js/classes/interface/settings/files/Loader.js
Loader
description: Loader enables us to load settings from an object or from a file.

name: settings
description: Settings object using this loader.

name: defaultSettings
description: Default settings.

name: load
description: Load the settings after checking if they are corrupted or not.

name: import
description:
Load the settings object from a JSON file on client's computer.
/!\ May be asynchronous depending on browsers implementation.

name: loadDefault
description: Initialize the graph by setting default values.

name: checkCorruption
description: Check the corruption of given settings as JSON object.

params.name: settings
params.description: settings to check if they are corrupted.

return.description:
string (== true) describing the error 
	if corrupted, false else.

name: js/classes/interface/settings/files/Saver.js
Saver
description:
Class enabling you to download the current settings or whatever text you want
on the client computer without server-side.

name: settings
description: Settings object using this loader.

name: save
description: Download the current settings.

name: download
description:
Download a file with given name and content.
/!\ May be asynchronous depending on browsers implementation.

name: js/classes/interface/settings/subsettings/Graph.js
Graph
description:
Class representing the graph of the simulation.

You can add targets, delete targets, and link
them together.

For each target, you can set :
	- robbersInterest (the probability of robbers attacking this target)
	- guardiansCost (the cost when guardians fail to protect the target)
	- guardiansReward (the reward when guardians manage to prevent 
						an attack)
	- robberSettings (the cost, reward and probability for each robber)
		(Set through the Robbers class)

Nodes = Attacks = Targets

name: settings
description: Settings object using this graph.

name: stylesheet
description: Graph style.

name: cy
description: Cytoscape graph linked to this graph.

name: refreshInterval
description: Interval that refresh the cytoscape graph.

name: currentAction
description: What the user is currently doing.

name: lastSelectedNode
description: The node that was clicked the last.

name: init
description: Initialize the graph by setting default values.

name: nbrEdgesCreated
description:
Number of edges created.
Deleting an edge doesn't decrease that counter.

name: nbrNodesCreated
description:
Number of created nodes.
Deleting a node doesn't decrease this counter.

name: lastSelectedNode
description: The node that was clicked the last.

name: currentAction
description: What the user is currently doing.

name: sort
description: Sort targets with the CoSE layout (by Bilkent University).

name: reset
description: Reset the current action, selected target and hide the tips.

name: link
description: Link two targets together. You have to specify the ids.

name: addNode
description:
Add a node to the graph.

Base nodes can not been attacket nor defended.
Patrols have to start at the base.

params.name: base
params.description: do you want to add a base (you shouldn't, except the first one)

params.name: robbersInterest
params.description: How often will robbers attack this target compared to others.

params.name: guardiansCost
params.description: How much will it cost to the guardian to not catch the robber on this node.

params.name: guardiansReward
params.description: How much will a guardian earn from catching a robber on this node.

name: length
description: Return the length of an edge.

name: distance
description: Return the distance between dwo vertices.

name: getSettings
description: Concatenate settings into a JSON object.

name: js/classes/interface/settings/subsettings/Robbers.js
Robbers
description: Sub-setting for robbers manipulation.

name: settings
description: Settings object using this robbers.

name: init
description: Initialize the robbers by setting default values.

name: numberOfRobbersCreated
description:
Number of robbers created until now.
Deleting a robber doesn't decrease that counter.

name: list
description: Set of all robbers.
todo: We should probably change the name of this variable.

name: catchProbability
description: Probability of beeing caught for each robber.

name: newRobber
description:
Add a robber to the settings.
His card can be seen in the "Robbers" tab.
His settings are set to default in every target.

params.name: catchProbability
params.description: the catch probability of the new robber.

name: removeRobber
description:
Remove a robber from the settings.
His card gets removed and references to his settings are
removed from each target.

name: configureRobber
description:
Display a modal enabling the user to set the
robber properties for every target.

name: getSettings
description: Return the list of every robber.

name: js/main.js
updateHash
description:
Function called whenever the hash is updated to do the correct
action.

name: setupDOM
description: Setup non-specific DOM listeners and initialize modules.
